sec.div: Covariation between offspring begging and the growth rate of the foster nestlings as a proxy for feeding behaviour
sec.p: The begging intensity of focal nestlings was significantly and positively related to the growth rate of foster nestlings that were raised by the focal parents (LMM, F 1,15 = 9.82, P = 0.007, Figure 1B). The begging intensity and growth rate of focal nestlings tended to covary negatively, but this was not statistically significant ( F 1,15 = 3.52, P = 0.08). Removing the term “growth rate of focal nestlings”, made little difference to the results ( F 1,16 = 9.36, P = 0.008).
